name: Muni
description: Free Muni for youth (excludes cable cars), income-eligible seniors/people with disabilities, Access Pass, Lifeline Pass, free with Chase Center event ticket
fullDescription: San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency (SFMTA) operates Muni, the city's public transit system including buses, light rail (Metro), cable cars, and historic streetcars. Multiple free and discounted fare programs are available.
whatTheyOffer:
- Free Muni for Youth (ages 5-18): Free on all Muni except cable cars
- Free Muni for Seniors/Disabled: For income-eligible seniors 65+ and people with disabilities
- Lifeline Pass: Discounted monthly pass for low-income adults
- Free rides with Chase Center event tickets (game day)
- Veterans and military discounts available
howToGetIt:
1. Youth: Apply online at sfmta.com/freemunioryouth
2. Seniors/Disabled: Apply online with proof of age, disability, and income
3. Lifeline Pass: Apply through SFMTA with proof of low income
4. Chase Center: Show your event ticket on game day for free Muni
5. All programs require Clipper card
keywords: Muni, SFMTA, San Francisco, free transit, youth, seniors, disability, Lifeline Pass, bus, light rail, cable car
